messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] History Dragon Dynasty Katana
messages.msgSnippet: Welome to the forum and thanks for your interest;  I am sure that the symbols are copies of symbols once used and ;  I am guessing that the best way would be
messages.messageBody:
Welome to the forum and thanks for your interest; I am sure that the symbols
are copies of symbols once used and ; I am guessing that the best way would
be to just look at them and think what they are and do a goolge search on
that.. and I am sure that there are people in this forum that would be will to
look at the symbols and give you some clue at least as to what they are and
maybe where they may habe been used in the past. There are many people in this
realm that are more qualified then I ; I am sure they would love to at least
give you some websites on this and also.. some insigt... I hop you enjoy the
forum...

Blessing..


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] History Dragon Dynasty Katana
messages.msgSnippet: Alneil et al - Seriously such things did not exist in History , below is a link to a fabulous online resource for valid information on just about anything
messages.messageBody:
Alneil et al -
Seriously such things did not exist in "History", below is a link to
a fabulous online resource for valid information on just about
anything connected to the Japanese Sword. http://home.earthlink.net/
~steinrl/nihonto.htm
Check it out. If you or anyone here are seriously interested in
swords we welcome new members of all ages and levels of interest;
www.ncjsc.org

Tom Helm
Northern California Japanese Sword Club

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] History Dragon Dynasty Katana" To: Anthony Bryant
messages.msgSnippet: lol again. Anthony Bryant.....i ve got a ? for u. For moriage zane do i lacquer again after shita garami process to give it that built up edge look? if
messages.messageBody:
lol again. Anthony Bryant.....i've got a ? for u. For "moriage zane" do i lacquer again after shita garami process to give it that "built up edge" look? if your looking directly a section of board(laced hon kozane), do i lacquer up the right edge of every scale? thanks a bunch.
mark

Alneil Mc.Leod wrote:

> Hi Anthony,
>
> It doesn't mean anything? Launch into your obscenity-ridden tirade
> that would make grown men flinch and soldiers cry, do tell.


I would, but the doctor says I need to cut down...


Tony

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] History Dragon Dynasty Katana
messages.msgSnippet: lol ... They don t mean squat. It s NOT an Asian design. I m sorry, but I really can t say more about it without launching into an obscenity-ridden tirade that
messages.messageBody:
lol

Anthony Bryant <anthony_bryant@...> wrote: Alneil Mc.Leod wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I have a dragon dynasty Katana and I'm interested in finding out what
> the carvings mean, the story behind them.
> I eagerly await your response.

They don't mean squat. It's NOT an Asian design.

I'm sorry, but I really can't say more about it without
launching into an obscenity-ridden tirade that would make
grown men flinch and sailors cry.

Tony
___

messages.messageBody:
Alneil Mc.Leod wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I have a dragon dynasty Katana and I'm interested in finding out what
> the carvings mean, the story behind them.
> I eagerly await your response.

They don't mean squat. It's NOT an Asian design.

I'm sorry, but I really can't say more about it without
launching into an obscenity-ridden tirade that would make
grown men flinch and sailors cry.

Tony

messages.subject: History Dragon Dynasty Katana
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I have a dragon dynasty Katana and I m interested in finding out what the carvings mean, the story behind them. I eagerly await your response. Many
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I have a dragon dynasty Katana and I'm interested in finding out what
the carvings mean, the story behind them.
I eagerly await your response.

Many thanks,

Mc.Leod
--
